    26â†’```
    27â†’
    28â†’### 1.2 Data Flow Architecture
    29â†’
    30â†’```
    31â†’Input (3D Binary Tensor)
    32â†’        â†“
    33â†’[Validation & Preprocessing]
    34â†’        â†“
    35â†’[Block Division (2Ã—2Ã—2)]
    36â†’        â†“
    37â†’[Initialization Kernel] â†’ Initialize Union-Find Structure
    38â†’        â†“
    39â†’[Merge Kernel] â†’ Connect Adjacent Blocks (Atomic Operations)
    40â†’        â†“
    41â†’[Compression Kernel] â†’ Flatten Union-Find Trees
    42â†’        â†“
    43â†’[Final Labeling Kernel] â†’ Assign Labels to Voxels
    44â†’        â†“
    45â†’Output (Labeled Tensor, Component Count)
    46â†’```
    47â†’
    48â†’### 1.3 Module Architecture
    49â†’
    50â†’```
    51â†’fastlabel/
    52â†’â”œâ”€â”€ Public Interface Layer
    53â†’â”‚   â””â”€â”€ __init__.py â†’ Exports main API (label, label_batch)
    54â†’â”‚
    55â†’â”œâ”€â”€ Core Algorithm Layer (core/)
    56â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ buf_3d.py â†’ Main BUF algorithm orchestration
    57â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ kernels.py â†’ PyTorch kernel implementations
    58â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ union_find.py â†’ GPU-optimized union-find operations
    59â†’â”‚   â””â”€â”€ blocks.py â†’ Block processing and management
    60â†’â”‚
    61â†’â”œâ”€â”€ Utility Layer (utils/)
    62â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ connectivity.py â†’ 6/26-connectivity definitions
    63â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ memory.py â†’ Memory pool and management
    64â†’â”‚   â””â”€â”€ validation.py â†’ Input validation and sanitization
    65â†’â”‚
    66â†’â”œâ”€â”€ Quality Assurance Layer
    67â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ tests/ â†’ Comprehensive test suite
    68â†’â”‚   â””â”€â”€ benchmarks/ â†’ Performance measurement tools
    69â†’â”‚
    70â†’â””â”€â”€ Configuration
    71â†’    â”œâ”€â”€ pyproject.toml â†’ Project dependencies (uv)
    72â†’    â””â”€â”€ .github/workflows/ â†’ CI/CD pipelines
    73â†’```
    74â†’
    75â†’## 2. Technology Stack
    76â†’
    77â†’### 2.1 Core Technologies
    78â†’
    79â†’| Component | Technology | Version | Purpose |
    80â†’|-----------|------------|---------|---------|
    81â†’| Language | Python | 3.12+ | Primary development language |
    82â†’| GPU Framework | PyTorch | 2.8+ | GPU acceleration and tensor operations |
    83â†’| CUDA Support | CUDA | 11.0+ | NVIDIA GPU backend |
    84â†’| MPS Support | Metal | Latest | Apple Silicon GPU backend |
    85â†’| Package Manager | uv | Latest | Fast Python package management |
    86â†’| Testing | pytest | 8.0+ | Test framework |
    87â†’| Benchmarking | pytest-benchmark | 4.0+ | Performance testing |
    88â†’| Code Quality | ruff | Latest | Linting and formatting |
    89â†’| Type Checking | mypy | 1.5+ | Static type checking |
    90â†’| Documentation | mkdocs | Latest | Documentation generation |
    91â†’
    92â†’### 2.2 Development Dependencies
    93â†’
    94â†’```toml
    95â†’[project]
    96â†’name = "fastlabel"
    97â†’version = "0.1.0"
    98â†’requires-python = ">=3.12"
    99â†’dependencies = [
   100â†’    "torch>=2.8.0",

   129â†’
   130â†’### 2.3 Hardware Requirements
   131â†’
   132â†’- **Development Machine**:
   133â†’  - NVIDIA GPU with CUDA 11.0+ OR Apple Silicon Mac with MPS
   134â†’  - Minimum 8GB GPU memory (16GB+ recommended)
   135â†’  - 32GB+ system RAM for large volume testing
   136â†’
   137â†’- **CI/CD Environment**:
   138â†’  - GitHub Actions with GPU runners
   139â†’  - Docker containers with CUDA support
   140â†’  - Apple Silicon runners for MPS testing
   141â†’
   142â†’## 3. Development Process & Workflow
   143â†’
   144â†’### 3.1 Test-Driven Development (TDD) Workflow
   145â†’
   146â†’```mermaid
   147â†’graph LR
   148â†’    A[Write Failing Test] --> B[Run Test - Verify Failure]
   149â†’    B --> C[Write Minimal Code]
   150â†’    C --> D[Run Test - Verify Pass]
   151â†’    D --> E[Refactor Code]
   152â†’    E --> F[Run All Tests]
   153â†’    F --> G{All Pass?}
   154â†’    G -->|Yes| H[Commit]
   155â†’    G -->|No| C
   156â†’```
   157â†’
   158â†’**TDD Rules**:
   159â†’1. **RED Phase**: Write test first, ensure it fails
   160â†’2. **GREEN Phase**: Write minimal code to pass
   161â†’3. **REFACTOR Phase**: Clean up while keeping tests green
   162â†’4. **NEVER** modify tests to make code pass (only fix actual test errors)
   163â†’
   164â†’### 3.2 Development Workflow
   165â†’
   166â†’#### 3.2.1 Session Start Checklist
   167â†’```markdown
   168â†’- [ ] Read CLAUDE.md for context
   169â†’- [ ] Review PLANNING.md for architecture
   170â†’- [ ] Check TASKS.md for current priorities
   171â†’- [ ] Review SCRATCHPAD.md for ongoing work
   172â†’- [ ] Pull latest changes from main branch
   173â†’- [ ] Create feature branch
   174â†’```
   175â†’
   176â†’#### 3.2.2 Feature Development Process
   177â†’```
   178â†’1. Pick task from TASKS.md
   179â†’2. Write comprehensive tests (TDD)
   180â†’3. Implement feature
   181â†’4. Run test suite
   182â†’5. Profile performance
   183â†’6. Document code
   184â†’7. Update TASKS.md
   185â†’8. Create pull request
   186â†’```
   187â†’
   188â†’#### 3.2.3 Code Review Checklist
   189â†’```markdown
   190â†’- [ ] All tests pass (including new ones)
   191â†’- [ ] Code coverage â‰¥ 90%
   192â†’- [ ] Type hints complete
   193â†’- [ ] Docstrings comprehensive
   194â†’- [ ] Performance benchmarks meet targets
   195â†’- [ ] No regressions in existing functionality
   196â†’- [ ] Memory usage within limits
   197â†’- [ ] Documentation updated
   198â†’```
   199â†’
   200â†’### 3.3 Git Workflow
   201â†’
   202â†’```
   203â†’main
   204â†’  â”œâ”€â”€ develop
   205â†’  â”‚     â”œâ”€â”€ feature/initialization-kernel
   206â†’  â”‚     â”œâ”€â”€ feature/merge-kernel
   207â†’  â”‚     â”œâ”€â”€ feature/compression-kernel
   208â†’  â”‚     â””â”€â”€ feature/final-labeling
   209â†’  â””â”€â”€ release/v1.0.0
   210â†’```
   211â†’
   212â†’**Branch Strategy**:
   213â†’- `main`: Production-ready code
   214â†’- `develop`: Integration branch
   215â†’- `feature/*`: Individual features
   216â†’- `bugfix/*`: Bug fixes
   217â†’- `release/*`: Release preparation
   218â†’
   219â†’**Commit Convention**:
   220â†’```
   221â†’<type>(<scope>): <subject>
   222â†’
   223â†’<body>
   224â†’
   225â†’<footer>
   226â†’```
   227â†’
   228â†’Types: `feat`, `fix`, `docs`, `style`, `refactor`, `test`, `chore`
   229â†’
   230â†’### 3.4 Testing Strategy
   231â†’
   232â†’#### 3.4.1 Test Pyramid
   233â†’```
   234â†’         /\
   235â†’        /  \  E2E Tests (5%)
   236â†’       /â”€â”€â”€â”€\
   237â†’      /      \  Integration Tests (25%)
   238â†’     /â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€\
   239â†’    /          \  Unit Tests (70%)
   240â†’   /â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€\
   241â†’```
   242â†’
   243â†’#### 3.4.2 Test Categories
   244â†’
   245â†’| Category | Purpose | Location | Frequency |
   246â†’|----------|---------|----------|-----------|
   247â†’| Unit | Test individual kernels | tests/unit/ | Every commit |
   248â†’| Integration | Test algorithm pipeline | tests/integration/ | Every PR |
   249â†’| Comparison | Verify scipy compatibility | tests/comparison/ | Every PR |
   250â†’| Performance | Benchmark speed | tests/performance/ | Weekly |
   251â†’| Edge Cases | Test boundary conditions | tests/edge_cases/ | Every PR |
   252â†’| Stress | Test large volumes | tests/stress/ | Release |
   253â†’
   254â†’#### 3.4.3 Test Data Strategy
   255â†’```python
   256â†’# Test data generators in benchmarks/datasets.py
   257â†’def generate_test_volumes():
   258â†’    return {
   259â†’        'random_noise': lambda: random_binary_volume(density=0.5),
   260â†’        'sparse': lambda: random_binary_volume(density=0.05),
   261â†’        'dense': lambda: random_binary_volume(density=0.95),
   262â†’        'single_component': lambda: sphere_volume(),
   263â†’        'multiple_spheres': lambda: multiple_spheres_volume(),
   264â†’        'empty': lambda: torch.zeros((128, 128, 128)),
   265â†’        'full': lambda: torch.ones((128, 128, 128)),
   266â†’    }
   267â†’```
   268â†’
   269â†’### 3.5 Performance Optimization Workflow
   270â†’
   271â†’```
   272â†’1. Baseline Measurement
   273â†’   â””â”€â”€ Profile with PyTorch Profiler
   274â†’   
   275â†’2. Identify Bottlenecks
   276â†’   â”œâ”€â”€ Kernel execution time
   277â†’   â”œâ”€â”€ Memory transfers
   278â†’   â””â”€â”€ Atomic operation contention
   279â†’   
   280â†’3. Optimization Cycle
   281â†’   â”œâ”€â”€ Hypothesis
   282â†’   â”œâ”€â”€ Implementation
   283â†’   â”œâ”€â”€ Measurement
   284â†’   â””â”€â”€ Validation
   285â†’   
   286â†’4. Performance Regression Testing
   287â†’   â””â”€â”€ Automated benchmarks in CI
   288â†’```
   289â†’
   290â†’## 4. Required Tools
   291â†’
   292â†’### 4.1 Development Tools
   293â†’
   294â†’| Tool | Purpose | Installation |
   295â†’|------|---------|--------------|
   296â†’| uv | Package management | `curl -LsSf https://astral.sh/uv/install.sh \| sh` |
   297â†’| pytest | Testing framework | `uv pip install pytest` |
   298â†’| ruff | Linting/Formatting | `uv pip install ruff` |
   299â†’| mypy | Type checking | `uv pip install mypy` |
   300â†’| pre-commit | Git hooks | `uv pip install pre-commit` |
   301â†’
   302â†’### 4.2 Profiling & Debugging Tools
   303â†’
   304â†’| Tool | Purpose | Usage |
   305â†’|------|---------|-------|
   306â†’| PyTorch Profiler | GPU kernel profiling | `torch.profiler.profile()` |
   307â†’| NVIDIA Nsight | CUDA debugging | `nsys profile python script.py` |
   308â†’| nvtop | GPU monitoring | `nvtop` |
   309â†’| py-spy | Python profiling | `py-spy record -o profile.svg -- python script.py` |
   310â†’| memray | Memory profiling | `memray run script.py` |
   311â†’
   312â†’### 4.3 Documentation Tools
   313â†’
   314â†’| Tool | Purpose | Configuration |
   315â†’|------|---------|---------------|
   316â†’| mkdocs | Documentation site | mkdocs.yml |
   317â†’| mkdocstrings | API documentation | Auto-generate from docstrings |
   318â†’| mermaid | Diagrams | Inline in markdown |
   319â†’| sphinx | Alternative docs | conf.py |
   320â†’
   321â†’### 4.4 CI/CD Tools
   322â†’
   323â†’```yaml
   324â†’# .github/workflows/ci.yml
   325â†’name: CI Pipeline
   326â†’on: [push, pull_request]
   327â†’
   328â†’jobs:
   329â†’  test:
   330â†’    runs-on: [self-hosted, gpu]
   331â†’    steps:
   332â†’      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
   333â†’      - uses: astral/setup-uv@v1
   334â†’      - run: uv pip install -e ".[dev]"
   335â†’      - run: pytest --cov=fastlabel --cov-report=xml
   336â†’      - run: ruff check .
   337â†’      - run: mypy fastlabel
   338â†’      
   339â†’  benchmark:
   340â†’    runs-on: [self-hosted, gpu]
   341â†’    steps:
   342â†’      - run: pytest benchmarks/ --benchmark-only
   343â†’      - run: python benchmarks/compare_scipy.py
   344â†’```
   345â†’
   346â†’## 5. Development Phases
   347â†’
   348â†’### Phase 1: Foundation (Week 1-2)
   349â†’```
   350â†’â”œâ”€â”€ Setup project structure with uv
   351â†’â”œâ”€â”€ Configure testing framework
   352â†’â”œâ”€â”€ Implement basic union-find
   353â†’â”œâ”€â”€ Create test data generators
   354â†’â””â”€â”€ Establish CI/CD pipeline
   355â†’```
   356â†’
   357â†’### Phase 2: Core Algorithm (Week 3-4)
   358â†’```
   359â†’â”œâ”€â”€ Initialization kernel
   360â†’â”œâ”€â”€ Merge kernel with atomics
   361â†’â”œâ”€â”€ Compression kernel
   362â†’â”œâ”€â”€ Final labeling kernel
   363â†’â””â”€â”€ Integration tests
   364â†’```
   365â†’
   366â†’### Phase 3: Optimization (Week 5-6)
   367â†’```
   368â†’â”œâ”€â”€ Profile with PyTorch Profiler
   369â†’â”œâ”€â”€ Optimize memory access patterns
   370â†’â”œâ”€â”€ Implement inline compression
   371â†’â”œâ”€â”€ Add MPS backend support
   372â†’â””â”€â”€ Batch processing optimization
   373â†’```
   374â†’
   375â†’### Phase 4: Quality Assurance (Week 7-8)
   376â†’```
   377â†’â”œâ”€â”€ Comprehensive test coverage
   378â†’â”œâ”€â”€ Performance benchmarking
   379â†’â”œâ”€â”€ Edge case testing

   392â†’
   393â†’## 6. Performance Monitoring
   394â†’
   395â†’### 6.1 Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)
   396â†’
   397â†’| Metric | Target | Measurement |
   398â†’|--------|--------|-------------|
   399â†’| Speedup vs scipy | 10-50x | `time_fastlabel / time_scipy` |
   400â†’| Memory efficiency | < 2x input | `peak_memory / input_size` |
   401â†’| Accuracy | 100% | `compare_with_scipy()` |
   402â†’| Throughput | > 1 GVoxel/s | `voxels / execution_time` |
   403â†’| Latency (512Â³) | < 1s | `end_to_end_time` |
   404â†’
   405â†’### 6.2 Benchmarking Suite
   406â†’
   407â†’```python
   408â†’# benchmarks/benchmark.py
   409â†’class FastLabelBenchmark:
   410â†’    def setup(self):
   411â†’        self.volumes = {
   412â†’            'small': torch.rand(64, 64, 64) > 0.5,
   413â†’            'medium': torch.rand(256, 256, 256) > 0.5,
   414â†’            'large': torch.rand(512, 512, 512) > 0.5,
   415â†’        }
   416â†’    
   417â†’    def time_fastlabel(self, size):
   418â†’        fastlabel.label(self.volumes[size])
   419â†’    
   420â†’    def time_scipy(self, size):
   421â†’        scipy.ndimage.label(self.volumes[size].cpu().numpy())
   422â†’    
   423â†’    def peakmem_fastlabel(self, size):
   424â†’        fastlabel.label(self.volumes[size])
   425â†’```
   426â†’
   427â†’## 7. Risk Management
   428â†’
   429â†’### 7.1 Technical Risks
   430â†’
   431â†’| Risk | Mitigation | Contingency |
   432â†’|------|------------|-------------|
   433â†’| PyTorch atomic limitations | Test early, optimize usage | Custom CUDA kernels |
   434â†’| MPS performance issues | Separate optimization path | CPU fallback warning |
   435â†’| Memory overflow | Chunk processing | Out-of-core algorithm |
   436â†’| Race conditions | Extensive testing | Lock-based fallback |
   437â†’
   438â†’### 7.2 Project Risks
   439â†’
   440â†’| Risk | Mitigation | Contingency |
   441â†’|------|------------|-------------|
   442â†’| Scope creep | Strict PRD adherence | Defer to v2.0 |
   443â†’| Performance regression | Automated benchmarks | Git bisect |
   444â†’| API incompatibility | Comprehensive testing | Compatibility layer |
   445â†’| Documentation lag | Doc-as-you-code | Sprint dedication |
   446â†’
   447â†’## 8. Communication & Collaboration
   448â†’
   449â†’### 8.1 Documentation Standards
   450â†’
   451â†’- **Code Comments**: Explain "why" not "what"
   452â†’- **Docstrings**: NumPy style, comprehensive
   453â†’- **Type Hints**: Complete coverage
   454â†’- **README**: Quick start and examples
   455â†’- **CHANGELOG**: Semantic versioning
   456â†’
   457â†’### 8.2 Code Review Process
   458â†’
   459â†’1. Self-review checklist completion
   460â†’2. Automated CI checks pass
   461â†’3. Peer review (min 1 reviewer)
   462â†’4. Performance benchmark comparison
   463â†’5. Merge to develop branch
   464â†’
   465â†’### 8.3 Knowledge Management
   466â†’
   467â†’- **CLAUDE.md**: Project context and guidelines
   468â†’- **PRD.md**: Requirements and specifications
   469â†’- **PLANNING.md**: This document
   470â†’- **TASKS.md**: Current task tracking
   471â†’- **SCRATCHPAD.md**: Working notes and ideas
   472â†’- **Wiki**: Extended documentation
   473â†’
   474â†’## 9. Success Metrics
   475â†’
   476â†’### 9.1 Technical Success
   477â†’- [ ] 10x+ speedup achieved
   478â†’- [ ] 100% scipy compatibility
   479â†’- [ ] 90%+ test coverage
   480â†’- [ ] Zero critical bugs
   481â†’- [ ] Sub-second 512Â³ processing

   489â†’
   490â†’
   491â†’## 10. Quick Reference
   492â†’
   493â†’### 10.1 Common Commands
   494â†’
   495â†’```bash
   496â†’# Setup
   497â†’uv venv
   498â†’uv pip install -e ".[dev]"
   499â†’
   500â†’# Testing
   501â†’pytest tests/                    # Run all tests
   502â†’pytest tests/unit/ -v            # Run unit tests verbose
   503â†’pytest --cov=fastlabel           # With coverage
   504â†’pytest -k "test_kernel"          # Run specific tests
   505â†’
   506â†’# Profiling
   507â†’python -m torch.profiler script.py
   508â†’nsys profile --stats=true python benchmark.py
   509â†’
   510â†’# Code Quality
   511â†’ruff check fastlabel/            # Lint
   512â†’ruff format fastlabel/           # Format
   513â†’mypy fastlabel/                  # Type check
   514â†’
   515â†’# Documentation
   516â†’mkdocs serve                     # Local preview
   517â†’mkdocs build                     # Build docs
   518â†’
   519â†’# Benchmarking
   520â†’python benchmarks/benchmark.py   # Run benchmarks
   521â†’python benchmarks/compare_scipy.py
   522â†’```
   523â†’
   524â†’### 10.2 File Templates
   525â†’
   526â†’#### Test Template
   527â†’```python
   528â†’"""Test module for [component]."""
   529â†’import pytest
   530â†’import torch
   531â†’from fastlabel import [module]
   532â†’
   533â†’@pytest.fixture
   534â†’def sample_volume():
   535â†’    """Generate sample test volume."""
   536â†’    return torch.rand(64, 64, 64) > 0.5
   537â†’
   538â†’def test_[functionality](sample_volume):
   539â†’    """Test [specific behavior]."""
   540â†’    # Arrange
   541â†’    expected = ...
   542â†’    
   543â†’    # Act
   544â†’    result = [module].function(sample_volume)
   545â†’    
   546â†’    # Assert
   547â†’    assert result == expected
   548â†’```
   549â†’
   550â†’#### Kernel Template
   551â†’```python
   552â†’"""[Kernel name] implementation."""
   553â†’import torch
   554â†’from typing import Tuple
   555â†’
   556â†’def [kernel_name](
   557â†’    input: torch.Tensor,
   558â†’    output: torch.Tensor,
   559â†’    block_size: Tuple[int, int, int] = (2, 2, 2)
   560â†’) -> torch.Tensor:
   561â†’    """
   562â†’    [Brief description].
   563â†’    
   564â†’    Args:
   565â†’        input: Input tensor of shape (D, H, W)
   566â†’        output: Output tensor to write to
   567â†’        block_size: Block dimensions for processing
   568â†’        
   569â†’    Returns:
   570â†’        Processed output tensor
   571â†’    """
   572â†’    # Implementation
   573â†’    pass
   574â†’```
   575â†’

Based on my analysis, I understand the current project state:


Project Status Summary


FastLabel is a high-performance GPU-accelerated replacement for scipy.ndimage.label() that:


    

  • Uses pure PyTorch (no C++ extensions)
    • 

  • Implements Block-based Union Find (BUF) algorithm for 3D connected components
    • 

  • Targets 10-50x speedup over scipy
    • 

  • Supports both CUDA and MPS backends
    • 



Current State:


    

  • Basic project structure exists with uv package management
    • 

  • Only an empty __init__.py file in src/fastlabel/
    • 

  • Project is in very early stage - Milestone 1 tasks from TASKS.md are not yet completed
    • 

  • No actual algorithm implementation yet
    • 



Key Files Status:


    

  • âœ… PLANNING.md - Comprehensive architecture and development plan
    • 

  • âœ… TASKS.md - Detailed milestone-based task breakdown
    • 

  • âœ… CLAUDE.md - Project context and guidelines
    • 

  • âš ï¸ SCRATCHPAD.md - Nearly empty, ready for notes
    • 

  • âš ï¸ pyproject.toml - Basic setup, needs completion per TASKS.md
    • 

  • âŒ Core algorithm files - None exist yet
    • 



Next Priority: Based on TASKS.md Milestone 1, the project needs:


    

  1. Complete environment setup (pyproject.toml dependencies)
    2. 

  2. Create proper directory structure (core/, utils/, tests/, benchmarks/)
    3. 

  3. Set up testing framework with TDD approach
    4. 

  4. Write failing tests for the main API
    5. 



The project is well-planned but implementation hasn't started. Ready to begin development following the TDD methodology outlined in CLAUDE.md.

{
  "file_path": "/Users/poldrack/Dropbox/code/agentic-coding/fastlabel/tests/test_api.py",
  "content": "\"\"\"API compatibility tests for FastLabel.\"\"\"\n\nimport pytest\nimport torch\nimport numpy as np\nfrom scipy import ndimage\nimport fastlabel\n\n\ndef test_label_api_basic(small_binary_volume):\n    \"\"\"Test basic label() API compatibility with scipy.\"\"\"\n    # This test will fail initially as label() doesn't exist yet\n    labels, num_features = fastlabel.label(small_binary_volume)\n    \n    # Check return types match scipy\n    assert isinstance(labels, torch.Tensor)\n    assert isinstance(num_features, int)\n    assert labels.shape == small_binary_volume.shape\n    assert labels.dtype == torch.int32\n    assert num_features >= 0\n\n\ndef test_label_scipy_compatibility(numpy_volumes):\n    \"\"\"Test exact compatibility with scipy.ndimage.label.\"\"\"\n    small_vol, _ = numpy_volumes\n    \n    # Get scipy result\n    scipy_labels, scipy_num = ndimage.label(small_vol)\n    \n    # Convert to torch and get fastlabel result\n    torch_vol = torch.from_numpy(small_vol).bool()\n    fl_labels, fl_num = fastlabel.label(torch_vol)\n    \n    # Check results match\n    assert fl_num == scipy_num\n    np.testing.assert_array_equal(fl_labels.cpu().numpy(), scipy_labels)\n\n\ndef test_label_with_structure():\n    \"\"\"Test label() with custom connectivity structure.\"\"\"\n    volume = torch.zeros((5, 5, 5), dtype=torch.bool)\n    volume[2, 2, 2] = True\n    volume[2, 2, 3] = True\n    \n    # Test with 6-connectivity structure\n    structure = torch.zeros((3, 3, 3), dtype=torch.bool)\n    structure[1, 1, 1] = True  # center\n    structure[0, 1, 1] = True  # face neighbors\n    structure[2, 1, 1] = True\n    structure[1, 0, 1] = True\n    structure[1, 2, 1] = True\n    structure[1, 1, 0] = True\n    structure[1, 1, 2] = True\n    \n    labels, num_features = fastlabel.label(volume, structure=structure)\n    assert isinstance(labels, torch.Tensor)\n    assert isinstance(num_features, int)\n\n\ndef test_label_with_output_tensor():\n    \"\"\"Test label() with pre-allocated output tensor.\"\"\"\n    volume = torch.ones((4, 4, 4), dtype=torch.bool)\n    output = torch.zeros((4, 4, 4), dtype=torch.int32)\n    \n    labels, num_features = fastlabel.label(volume, output=output)\n    \n    # Should return the same tensor we provided\n    assert labels is output\n    assert isinstance(num_features, int)"
}

__________________________ test_label_with_structure ___________________________

    def test_label_with_structure():
        """Test label() with custom connectivity structure."""
        volume = torch.zeros((5, 5, 5), dtype=torch.bool)
        volume[2, 2, 2] = True
        volume[2, 2, 3] = True
    
        # Test with 6-connectivity structure
        structure = torch.zeros((3, 3, 3), dtype=torch.bool)
        structure[1, 1, 1] = True  # center
        structure[0, 1, 1] = True  # face neighbors
        structure[2, 1, 1] = True
        structure[1, 0, 1] = True
        structure[1, 2, 1] = True
        structure[1, 1, 0] = True
        structure[1, 1, 2] = True
    
>       labels, num_features = fastlabel.label(volume, structure=structure)
                               ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

     2â†’

     4â†’import torch
     5â†’
     6â†’
     7â†’def main() -> str:
     8â†’    """Main function for CLI entry point."""
     9â†’    return "FastLabel v0.1.0 - GPU-accelerated connected components labeling"
    10â†’
    11â†’
    12â†’def label(
    13â†’    input: torch.Tensor,
    14â†’    structure: Optional[torch.Tensor] = None,
    15â†’    output: Optional[torch.Tensor] = None,
    16â†’) -> Tuple[torch.Tensor, int]:
    17â†’    """
    18â†’    Label connected components in a 3D binary tensor.
    19â†’    
    20â†’    Args:

    22â†’        structure: Connectivity structure (default: 26-connectivity)
    23â†’        output: Pre-allocated output tensor (optional)
    24â†’        
    25â†’    Returns:
    26â†’        labels: Labeled tensor (same shape as input)
    27â†’        num_features: Number of connected components
    28â†’    """
    29â†’    # Minimal implementation to pass tests - will be replaced with actual algorithm
    30â†’    if output is not None:
    31â†’        labels = output
    32â†’        labels.fill_(1 if input.any() else 0)
    33â†’    else:

    35â†’        labels[~input] = 0
    36â†’

    38â†’    return labels, num_features
    39â†’

diff --git a/src/fastlabel/__init__.py b/src/fastlabel/__init__.py
index e69de29..db8f561 100644
--- a/src/fastlabel/__init__.py
+++ b/src/fastlabel/__init__.py
@@ -0,0 +1,41 @@
+"""FastLabel: GPU-accelerated drop-in replacement for scipy.ndimage.label()."""
+
+from typing import Tuple, Optional
+import torch
+
+
+def main() -> str:
+    """Main function for CLI entry point."""
+    return "FastLabel v0.1.0 - GPU-accelerated connected components labeling"
+
+
+def label(
+    input: torch.Tensor,
+    structure: Optional[torch.Tensor] = None,
+    output: Optional[torch.Tensor] = None,
+) -> Tuple[torch.Tensor, int]:
+    """
+    Label connected components in a 3D binary tensor.
+    
+    Args:
+        input: Binary 3D tensor (D, H, W) or batch (B, D, H, W)
+        structure: Connectivity structure (default: 26-connectivity)
+        output: Pre-allocated output tensor (optional)
+        
+    Returns:
+        labels: Labeled tensor (same shape as input)
+        num_features: Number of connected components
+    """
+    # Minimal implementation to pass tests - will be replaced with actual algorithm
+    if output is not None:
+        labels = output
+        labels.fill_(1 if input.any() else 0)
+    else:
+        labels = torch.ones_like(input, dtype=torch.int32)
+        labels[~input] = 0
+    
+    num_features = 1 if input.any() else 0
+    return labels, num_features
+
+
+__all__ = ["main", "label"]
\ No newline at end of file

  "description": "Stage all changes for commit"

{
  "file_path": "/Users/poldrack/Dropbox/code/agentic-coding/fastlabel/tests/test_connectivity.py",
  "content": "\"\"\"Tests for connectivity utilities.\"\"\"\n\nimport pytest\nimport torch\nfrom fastlabel.utils import connectivity\n\n\ndef test_create_6_connectivity_structure():\n    \"\"\"Test creation of 6-connectivity structure tensor.\"\"\"\n    structure = connectivity.create_connectivity_structure(connectivity_type=6)\n    \n    # Should be 3x3x3 tensor\n    assert structure.shape == (3, 3, 3)\n    assert structure.dtype == torch.bool\n    \n    # Only face neighbors should be True (6-connectivity)\n    expected_neighbors = 7  # center + 6 faces\n    assert structure.sum().item() == expected_neighbors\n    \n    # Center should be True\n    assert structure[1, 1, 1] == True\n    \n    # Face neighbors should be True\n    assert structure[0, 1, 1] == True  # -x\n    assert structure[2, 1, 1] == True  # +x\n    assert structure[1, 0, 1] == True  # -y\n    assert structure[1, 2, 1] == True  # +y\n    assert structure[1, 1, 0] == True  # -z\n    assert structure[1, 1, 2] == True  # +z\n    \n    # Edge and corner neighbors should be False\n    assert structure[0, 0, 1] == False  # edge\n    assert structure[0, 0, 0] == False  # corner\n\n\ndef test_create_26_connectivity_structure():\n    \"\"\"Test creation of 26-connectivity structure tensor.\"\"\"\n    structure = connectivity.create_connectivity_structure(connectivity_type=26)\n    \n    # Should be 3x3x3 tensor\n    assert structure.shape == (3, 3, 3)\n    assert structure.dtype == torch.bool\n    \n    # All 26 neighbors + center should be True\n    expected_neighbors = 27  # center + 26 neighbors\n    assert structure.sum().item() == expected_neighbors\n    \n    # All positions should be True for 26-connectivity\n    assert structure.all() == True\n\n\ndef test_get_default_structure():\n    \"\"\"Test getting default connectivity structure.\"\"\"\n    # Should default to 26-connectivity\n    structure = connectivity.get_default_structure()\n    assert structure.shape == (3, 3, 3)\n    assert structure.sum().item() == 27  # 26-connectivity + center\n\n\ndef test_validate_structure_tensor():\n    \"\"\"Test structure tensor validation.\"\"\"\n    # Valid 3x3x3 structure\n    valid_structure = torch.ones((3, 3, 3), dtype=torch.bool)\n    assert connectivity.validate_structure(valid_structure) == True\n    \n    # Invalid shape\n    invalid_shape = torch.ones((2, 2, 2), dtype=torch.bool)\n    assert connectivity.validate_structure(invalid_shape) == False\n    \n    # Invalid dtype\n    invalid_dtype = torch.ones((3, 3, 3), dtype=torch.float32)\n    assert connectivity.validate_structure(invalid_dtype) == False\n    \n    # Center must be True\n    invalid_center = torch.ones((3, 3, 3), dtype=torch.bool)\n    invalid_center[1, 1, 1] = False\n    assert connectivity.validate_structure(invalid_center) == False\n\n\ndef test_structure_to_offsets():\n    \"\"\"Test conversion of structure tensor to neighbor offsets.\"\"\"\n    # Test 6-connectivity\n    structure_6 = connectivity.create_connectivity_structure(6)\n    offsets = connectivity.structure_to_offsets(structure_6)\n    \n    # Should have 6 offsets (excluding center)\n    assert len(offsets) == 6\n    \n    # Verify expected offsets are present\n    expected_offsets = {\n        (-1, 0, 0), (1, 0, 0),   # x-neighbors\n        (0, -1, 0), (0, 1, 0),   # y-neighbors  \n        (0, 0, -1), (0, 0, 1)    # z-neighbors\n    }\n    \n    actual_offsets = set(tuple(offset) for offset in offsets)\n    assert actual_offsets == expected_offsets\n\n\ndef test_connectivity_on_device(device):\n    \"\"\"Test connectivity structures work on different devices.\"\"\"\n    structure = connectivity.create_connectivity_structure(6, device=device)\n    assert structure.device == device\n    assert structure.dtype == torch.bool"

{

  "content": "\"\"\"Connectivity structu...

        
        

            
{
  "file_path": "/Users/poldrack/Dropbox/code/agentic-coding/fastlabel/src/fastlabel/utils/connectivity.py",
  "content": "\"\"\"Connectivity structure utilities for 3D connected components labeling.\"\"\"\n\nfrom typing import List, Tuple, Optional\nimport torch\n\n\ndef create_connectivity_structure(\n    connectivity_type: int = 26, device: Optional[torch.device] = None\n) -> torch.Tensor:\n    \"\"\"\n    Create a 3D connectivity structure tensor.\n    \n    Args:\n        connectivity_type: Type of connectivity (6 or 26)\n        device: Target device for the tensor\n        \n    Returns:\n        3x3x3 boolean tensor defining neighbor connectivity\n    \"\"\"\n    if device is None:\n        device = torch.device(\"cpu\")\n    \n    # Initialize 3x3x3 structure with all False\n    structure = torch.zeros((3, 3, 3), dtype=torch.bool, device=device)\n    \n    # Center voxel is always included\n    structure[1, 1, 1] = True\n    \n    if connectivity_type == 6:\n        # 6-connectivity: only face neighbors (\u00b11 in one dimension)\n        structure[0, 1, 1] = True  # -x\n        structure[2, 1, 1] = True  # +x\n        structure[1, 0, 1] = True  # -y\n        structure[1, 2, 1] = True  # +y\n        structure[1, 1, 0] = True  # -z\n        structure[1, 1, 2] = True  # +z\n        \n    elif connectivity_type == 26:\n        # 26-connectivity: all neighbors in 3x3x3 neighborhood\n        structure.fill_(True)\n        \n    else:\n        raise ValueError(f\"Unsupported connectivity type: {connectivity_type}\")\n    \n    return structure\n\n\ndef get_default_structure(device: Optional[torch.device] = None) -> torch.Tensor:\n    \"\"\"\n    Get the default connectivity structure (26-connectivity).\n    \n    Args:\n        device: Target device for the tensor\n        \n    Returns:\n        Default 26-connectivity structure tensor\n    \"\"\"\n    return create_connectivity_structure(26, device)\n\n\ndef validate_structure(structure: torch.Tensor) -> bool:\n    \"\"\"\n    Validate a connectivity structure tensor.\n    \n    Args:\n        structure: Connectivity structure tensor to validate\n        \n    Returns:\n        True if valid, False otherwise\n    \"\"\"\n    # Must be 3x3x3 boolean tensor\n    if structure.shape != (3, 3, 3):\n        return False\n    \n    if structure.dtype != torch.bool:\n        return False\n    \n    # Center voxel must be True\n    if not structure[1, 1, 1]:\n        return False\n    \n    return True\n\n\ndef structure_to_offsets(structure: torch.Tensor) -> List[Tuple[int, int, int]]:\n    \"\"\"\n    Convert connectivity structure to list of neighbor offsets.\n    \n    Args:\n        structure: 3x3x3 connectivity structure tensor\n        \n    Returns:\n        List of (dz, dy, dx) offsets for neighbors (excluding center)\n    \"\"\"\n    if not validate_structure(structure):\n        raise ValueError(\"Invalid connectivity structure\")\n    \n    offsets = []\n    \n    # Iterate through 3x3x3 neighborhood\n    for z in range(3):\n        for y in range(3):\n            for x in range(3):\n                # Skip center voxel\n                if z == 1 and y == 1 and x == 1:\n                    continue\n                    \n                # Add offset if this neighbor is included\n                if structure[z, y, x]:\n                    # Convert indices to offsets (-1, 0, +1)\n                    offset = (z - 1, y - 1, x - 1)\n                    offsets.append(offset)\n    \n    return offsets"
}

  "content": "\"\"\"Tests for input validation util...

        
        

            
{
  "file_path": "/Users/poldrack/Dropbox/code/agentic-coding/fastlabel/tests/test_validation.py",
  "content": "\"\"\"Tests for input validation utilities.\"\"\"\n\nimport pytest\nimport torch\nimport numpy as np\nfrom fastlabel.utils import validation\n\n\ndef test_validate_input_tensor_valid():\n    \"\"\"Test validation of valid input tensors.\"\"\"\n    # Valid 3D binary tensor\n    valid_3d = torch.zeros((10, 20, 30), dtype=torch.bool)\n    assert validation.validate_input_tensor(valid_3d) == True\n    \n    # Valid 4D batch tensor  \n    valid_4d = torch.zeros((2, 10, 20, 30), dtype=torch.bool)\n    assert validation.validate_input_tensor(valid_4d) == True\n    \n    # Valid uint8 tensor (should be convertible)\n    valid_uint8 = torch.zeros((10, 20, 30), dtype=torch.uint8)\n    assert validation.validate_input_tensor(valid_uint8) == True\n\n\ndef test_validate_input_tensor_invalid():\n    \"\"\"Test validation of invalid input tensors.\"\"\"\n    # Wrong number of dimensions\n    invalid_2d = torch.zeros((10, 20), dtype=torch.bool)\n    assert validation.validate_input_tensor(invalid_2d) == False\n    \n    invalid_5d = torch.zeros((2, 3, 10, 20, 30), dtype=torch.bool)\n    assert validation.validate_input_tensor(invalid_5d) == False\n    \n    # Invalid dtype\n    invalid_float = torch.zeros((10, 20, 30), dtype=torch.float32)\n    assert validation.validate_input_tensor(invalid_float) == False\n    \n    # Non-tensor input\n    invalid_numpy = np.zeros((10, 20, 30), dtype=bool)\n    assert validation.validate_input_tensor(invalid_numpy) == False\n\n\ndef test_validate_output_tensor_valid():\n    \"\"\"Test validation of valid output tensors.\"\"\"\n    input_shape = (10, 20, 30)\n    \n    # Valid output tensor with correct shape and dtype\n    valid_output = torch.zeros(input_shape, dtype=torch.int32)\n    assert validation.validate_output_tensor(valid_output, input_shape) == True\n    \n    # Valid int64 output (should be acceptable)\n    valid_int64 = torch.zeros(input_shape, dtype=torch.int64)\n    assert validation.validate_output_tensor(valid_int64, input_shape) == True\n\n\ndef test_validate_output_tensor_invalid():\n    \"\"\"Test validation of invalid output tensors.\"\"\"\n    input_shape = (10, 20, 30)\n    \n    # Wrong shape\n    wrong_shape = torch.zeros((10, 20, 20), dtype=torch.int32)\n    assert validation.validate_output_tensor(wrong_shape, input_shape) == False\n    \n    # Wrong dtype\n    wrong_dtype = torch.zeros(input_shape, dtype=torch.float32)\n    assert validation.validate_output_tensor(wrong_dtype, input_shape) == False\n    \n    # Wrong dtype (bool)\n    wrong_bool = torch.zeros(input_shape, dtype=torch.bool)\n    assert validation.validate_output_tensor(wrong_bool, input_shape) == False\n\n\ndef test_ensure_binary_tensor():\n    \"\"\"Test conversion to binary tensor.\"\"\"\n    # Boolean tensor (should pass through unchanged)\n    bool_tensor = torch.tensor([True, False, True])\n    result = validation.ensure_binary_tensor(bool_tensor)\n    assert result.dtype == torch.bool\n    torch.testing.assert_close(result, bool_tensor)\n    \n    # uint8 tensor (should convert)\n    uint8_tensor = torch.tensor([1, 0, 255], dtype=torch.uint8)\n    result = validation.ensure_binary_tensor(uint8_tensor)\n    assert result.dtype == torch.bool\n    expected = torch.tensor([True, False, True])\n    torch.testing.assert_close(result, expected)\n    \n    # int32 tensor (should convert)\n    int32_tensor = torch.tensor([1, 0, -5], dtype=torch.int32)\n    result = validation.ensure_binary_tensor(int32_tensor)\n    assert result.dtype == torch.bool\n    expected = torch.tensor([True, False, True])\n    torch.testing.assert_close(result, expected)\n\n\ndef test_ensure_binary_tensor_invalid():\n    \"\"\"Test conversion failure for invalid dtypes.\"\"\"\n    # Float tensor should raise error\n    float_tensor = torch.tensor([1.0, 0.0, 0.5], dtype=torch.float32)\n    with pytest.raises(ValueError, match=\"Cannot convert.*to binary\"):\n        validation.ensure_binary_tensor(float_tensor)\n\n\ndef test_validate_dimensions():\n    \"\"\"Test dimension validation.\"\"\"\n    # Valid 3D dimensions\n    assert validation.validate_dimensions((64, 64, 64)) == True\n    assert validation.validate_dimensions((1, 1, 1)) == True\n    assert validation.validate_dimensions((512, 256, 128)) == True\n    \n    # Invalid dimensions\n    assert validation.validate_dimensions((0, 64, 64)) == False  # zero dimension\n    assert validation.validate_dimensions((-1, 64, 64)) == False  # negative\n    assert validation.validate_dimensions((64, 64)) == False  # wrong length\n    assert validation.validate_dimensions((64, 64, 64, 64)) == False  # wrong length\n\n\ndef test_check_memory_requirements():\n    \"\"\"Test memory requirement checking.\"\"\"\n    # Small volume should be fine\n    small_shape = (32, 32, 32)\n    assert validation.check_memory_requirements(small_shape, torch.device(\"cpu\")) == True\n    \n    # Very large volume should fail\n    huge_shape = (10000, 10000, 10000)  # ~4TB memory requirement\n    assert validation.check_memory_requirements(huge_shape, torch.device(\"cpu\")) == False\n\n\ndef test_sanitize_input():\n    \"\"\"Test complete input sanitization pipeline.\"\"\"\n    # Valid uint8 input\n    input_tensor = torch.ones((16, 16, 16), dtype=torch.uint8)\n    sanitized = validation.sanitize_input(input_tensor)\n    assert sanitized.dtype == torch.bool\n    assert sanitized.shape == (16, 16, 16)\n    \n    # Input with invalid values should be handled\n    mixed_input = torch.tensor([[[0, 1, 2], [255, 128, 0]]], dtype=torch.uint8)\n    sanitized = validation.sanitize_input(mixed_input)\n    assert sanitized.dtype == torch.bool\n    expected = torch.tensor([[[False, True, True], [True, True, False]]])\n    torch.testing.assert_close(sanitized, expected)"
}

  "content": "\"\"\"Input validation and s...

        
        

            
{
  "file_path": "/Users/poldrack/Dropbox/code/agentic-coding/fastlabel/src/fastlabel/utils/validation.py",
  "content": "\"\"\"Input validation and sanitization utilities for FastLabel.\"\"\"\n\nfrom typing import Tuple, Union\nimport torch\n\n\ndef validate_input_tensor(input_tensor: torch.Tensor) -> bool:\n    \"\"\"\n    Validate input tensor for labeling.\n    \n    Args:\n        input_tensor: Tensor to validate\n        \n    Returns:\n        True if valid, False otherwise\n    \"\"\"\n    if not isinstance(input_tensor, torch.Tensor):\n        return False\n    \n    # Must be 3D or 4D (batch)\n    if input_tensor.ndim not in [3, 4]:\n        return False\n    \n    # Must be binary-compatible dtype\n    if input_tensor.dtype not in [torch.bool, torch.uint8, torch.int8, torch.int16, torch.int32, torch.int64]:\n        return False\n    \n    return True\n\n\ndef validate_output_tensor(output_tensor: torch.Tensor, input_shape: Tuple[int, ...]) -> bool:\n    \"\"\"\n    Validate output tensor for labeling.\n    \n    Args:\n        output_tensor: Output tensor to validate\n        input_shape: Expected shape (must match input)\n        \n    Returns:\n        True if valid, False otherwise\n    \"\"\"\n    if not isinstance(output_tensor, torch.Tensor):\n        return False\n    \n    # Shape must match input\n    if output_tensor.shape != input_shape:\n        return False\n    \n    # Must be integer dtype for labels\n    if output_tensor.dtype not in [torch.int32, torch.int64]:\n        return False\n    \n    return True\n\n\ndef ensure_binary_tensor(input_tensor: torch.Tensor) -> torch.Tensor:\n    \"\"\"\n    Convert input tensor to binary (boolean) tensor.\n    \n    Args:\n        input_tensor: Input tensor to convert\n        \n    Returns:\n        Binary tensor with same shape\n        \n    Raises:\n        ValueError: If tensor cannot be converted to binary\n    \"\"\"\n    if input_tensor.dtype == torch.bool:\n        return input_tensor\n    \n    if input_tensor.dtype in [torch.uint8, torch.int8, torch.int16, torch.int32, torch.int64]:\n        # Convert to boolean (non-zero values become True)\n        return input_tensor != 0\n    \n    raise ValueError(f\"Cannot convert tensor with dtype {input_tensor.dtype} to binary\")\n\n\ndef validate_dimensions(shape: Tuple[int, ...]) -> bool:\n    \"\"\"\n    Validate tensor dimensions.\n    \n    Args:\n        shape: Tensor shape tuple\n        \n    Returns:\n        True if valid, False otherwise\n    \"\"\"\n    # Must be 3D shape\n    if len(shape) != 3:\n        return False\n    \n    # All dimensions must be positive\n    if any(dim <= 0 for dim in shape):\n        return False\n    \n    return True\n\n\ndef check_memory_requirements(shape: Tuple[int, ...], device: torch.device) -> bool:\n    \"\"\"\n    Check if tensor shape fits in available memory.\n    \n    Args:\n        shape: Tensor shape\n        device: Target device\n        \n    Returns:\n        True if memory requirements are reasonable\n    \"\"\"\n    # Calculate approximate memory requirements (in bytes)\n    # Input (bool) + Output (int32) + intermediate tensors\n    num_elements = 1\n    for dim in shape:\n        num_elements *= dim\n    \n    # Rough estimate: bool (1 byte) + int32 (4 bytes) + overhead (2x)\n    estimated_bytes = num_elements * (1 + 4) * 2\n    \n    # Conservative limit: 1GB for single volume\n    max_bytes = 1024 * 1024 * 1024  # 1GB\n    \n    return estimated_bytes < max_bytes\n\n\ndef sanitize_input(input_tensor: torch.Tensor) -> torch.Tensor:\n    \"\"\"\n    Complete input sanitization pipeline.\n    \n    Args:\n        input_tensor: Raw input tensor\n        \n    Returns:\n        Sanitized binary tensor\n        \n    Raises:\n        ValueError: If input cannot be sanitized\n    \"\"\"\n    if not validate_input_tensor(input_tensor):\n        raise ValueError(\"Invalid input tensor\")\n    \n    # Convert to binary\n    binary_tensor = ensure_binary_tensor(input_tensor)\n    \n    # Check dimensions\n    if binary_tensor.ndim == 3:\n        if not validate_dimensions(binary_tensor.shape):\n            raise ValueError(f\"Invalid tensor dimensions: {binary_tensor.shape}\")\n    elif binary_tensor.ndim == 4:\n        # Check each volume in batch\n        for i in range(binary_tensor.shape[0]):\n            if not validate_dimensions(binary_tensor[i].shape):\n                raise ValueError(f\"Invalid tensor dimensions in batch[{i}]: {binary_tensor[i].shape}\")\n    \n    # Check memory requirements\n    if binary_tensor.ndim == 3:\n        if not check_memory_requirements(binary_tensor.shape, binary_tensor.device):\n            raise ValueError(\"Tensor too large for available memory\")\n    \n    return binary_tensor"
}

        ...,
     ...1, ..., 0, 0, 0],

        [0, 0, 1, ..., 0, 1, 0]]], shape=(32, 32, 32), dtype=uint8))

    def test_label_scipy_compatibility(numpy_volumes):
        """Test exact compatibility with scipy.ndimage.label."""
        small_vol, _ = numpy_volumes
    
        # Get scipy result
        scipy_labels, scipy_num = ndimage.label(small_vol)
    
        # Convert to torch and get fastlabel result
        torch_vol = torch.from_numpy(small_vol).bool()
        fl_labels, fl_num = fastlabel.label(torch_vol)
    
        # Check results match
>       assert fl_num == scipy_num
E       assert 1 == 276

{
  "file_path": "/Users/poldrack/Dropbox/code/agentic-coding/fastlabel/tests/test_memory.py",
  "content": "\"\"\"Tests for memory management utiliti...

        
        

            
{
  "file_path": "/Users/poldrack/Dropbox/code/agentic-coding/fastlabel/tests/test_memory.py",
  "content": "\"\"\"Tests for memory management utilities.\"\"\"\n\nimport pytest\nimport torch\nfrom fastlabel.utils import memory\n\n\ndef test_estimate_memory_usage():\n    \"\"\"Test memory usage estimation for tensors.\"\"\"\n    # Small volume\n    small_shape = (32, 32, 32)\n    small_usage = memory.estimate_memory_usage(small_shape, torch.bool, torch.int32)\n    \n    # Should account for input (bool) + output (int32) + overhead\n    expected_small = 32**3 * (1 + 4) * 2  # 2x overhead factor\n    assert small_usage == expected_small\n    \n    # Large volume  \n    large_shape = (256, 256, 256)\n    large_usage = memory.estimate_memory_usage(large_shape, torch.bool, torch.int32)\n    assert large_usage > small_usage\n\n\ndef test_get_available_memory():\n    \"\"\"Test getting available GPU memory.\"\"\"\n    device = torch.device(\"cpu\")\n    cpu_mem = memory.get_available_memory(device)\n    assert cpu_mem > 0\n    \n    if torch.cuda.is_available():\n        gpu_device = torch.device(\"cuda\")\n        gpu_mem = memory.get_available_memory(gpu_device)\n        assert gpu_mem > 0\n    \n    if torch.backends.mps.is_available():\n        mps_device = torch.device(\"mps\")\n        mps_mem = memory.get_available_memory(mps_device)\n        assert mps_mem > 0\n\n\ndef test_check_memory_availability():\n    \"\"\"Test memory availability checking.\"\"\"\n    device = torch.device(\"cpu\")\n    \n    # Small tensor should fit\n    small_shape = (16, 16, 16)\n    assert memory.check_memory_availability(small_shape, torch.bool, torch.int32, device) == True\n    \n    # Huge tensor should not fit\n    huge_shape = (10000, 10000, 10000)\n    assert memory.check_memory_availability(huge_shape, torch.bool, torch.int32, device) == False\n\n\nclass TestMemoryPool:\n    \"\"\"Test memory pool for tensor reuse.\"\"\"\n    \n    def test_create_memory_pool(self, device):\n        \"\"\"Test memory pool creation.\"\"\"\n        pool = memory.MemoryPool(device)\n        assert pool.device == device\n        assert len(pool._tensors) == 0\n    \n    def test_allocate_tensor(self, device):\n        \"\"\"Test tensor allocation from pool.\"\"\"\n        pool = memory.MemoryPool(device)\n        \n        # First allocation should create new tensor\n        tensor1 = pool.allocate(torch.int32, (32, 32, 32))\n        assert tensor1.shape == (32, 32, 32)\n        assert tensor1.dtype == torch.int32\n        assert tensor1.device.type == device.type\n        \n        # Tensor should be zeroed\n        assert tensor1.sum().item() == 0\n    \n    def test_deallocate_tensor(self, device):\n        \"\"\"Test returning tensor to pool.\"\"\"\n        pool = memory.MemoryPool(device)\n        \n        # Allocate and deallocate\n        tensor = pool.allocate(torch.int32, (16, 16, 16))\n        key = (torch.int32, (16, 16, 16))\n        \n        pool.deallocate(tensor)\n        \n        # Should be stored in pool\n        assert key in pool._tensors\n        assert len(pool._tensors[key]) == 1\n    \n    def test_reuse_tensor(self, device):\n        \"\"\"Test tensor reuse from pool.\"\"\"\n        pool = memory.MemoryPool(device)\n        \n        # Allocate, deallocate, then allocate again\n        tensor1 = pool.allocate(torch.int32, (16, 16, 16))\n        pool.deallocate(tensor1)\n        \n        tensor2 = pool.allocate(torch.int32, (16, 16, 16))\n        \n        # Should reuse the same tensor\n        assert tensor2 is tensor1\n        \n        # Pool should be empty again\n        key = (torch.int32, (16, 16, 16))\n        assert len(pool._tensors[key]) == 0\n    \n    def test_clear_pool(self, device):\n        \"\"\"Test clearing memory pool.\"\"\"\n        pool = memory.MemoryPool(device)\n        \n        # Add some tensors\n        tensor1 = pool.allocate(torch.int32, (8, 8, 8))\n        tensor2 = pool.allocate(torch.bool, (16, 16, 16))\n        pool.deallocate(tensor1)\n        pool.deallocate(tensor2)\n        \n        # Clear pool\n        pool.clear()\n        assert len(pool._tensors) == 0\n    \n    def test_pool_statistics(self, device):\n        \"\"\"Test getting pool statistics.\"\"\"\n        pool = memory.MemoryPool(device)\n        \n        # Initial stats\n        stats = pool.get_stats()\n        assert stats[\"total_tensors\"] == 0\n        assert stats[\"total_memory_bytes\"] == 0\n        \n        # Add tensor\n        tensor = pool.allocate(torch.int32, (32, 32, 32))\n        pool.deallocate(tensor)\n        \n        stats = pool.get_stats()\n        assert stats[\"total_tensors\"] == 1\n        assert stats[\"total_memory_bytes\"] == 32**3 * 4  # int32 = 4 bytes\n\n\nclass TestMemoryContext:\n    \"\"\"Test memory context manager for automatic cleanup.\"\"\"\n    \n    def test_memory_context_creation(self, device):\n        \"\"\"Test creating memory context.\"\"\"\n        with memory.MemoryContext(device) as ctx:\n            assert ctx.device == device\n            assert isinstance(ctx.pool, memory.MemoryPool)\n    \n    def test_context_tensor_allocation(self, device):\n        \"\"\"Test tensor allocation within context.\"\"\"\n        with memory.MemoryContext(device) as ctx:\n            tensor = ctx.allocate_tensor(torch.int32, (16, 16, 16))\n            assert tensor.shape == (16, 16, 16)\n            assert tensor.dtype == torch.int32\n    \n    def test_context_automatic_cleanup(self, device):\n        \"\"\"Test automatic cleanup when context exits.\"\"\"\n        pool = None\n        with memory.MemoryContext(device) as ctx:\n            tensor = ctx.allocate_tensor(torch.int32, (16, 16, 16))\n            pool = ctx.pool\n            \n            # Pool should have tensors during context\n            stats = pool.get_stats()\n            # Tensor is allocated but not yet deallocated\n        \n        # After context exit, cleanup should have occurred\n        # Note: actual tensor may still exist but pool should be cleared\n        final_stats = pool.get_stats()\n        assert final_stats[\"total_tensors\"] == 0\n\n\ndef test_optimize_memory_layout():\n    \"\"\"Test memory layout optimization.\"\"\"\n    # Create tensor with suboptimal layout\n    tensor = torch.randn(64, 64, 64).transpose(0, 2)\n    assert not tensor.is_contiguous()\n    \n    # Optimize layout\n    optimized = memory.optimize_memory_layout(tensor)\n    assert optimized.is_contiguous()\n    torch.testing.assert_close(optimized, tensor.contiguous())\n\n\ndef test_get_tensor_memory_info():\n    \"\"\"Test getting tensor memory information.\"\"\"\n    tensor = torch.zeros(32, 32, 32, dtype=torch.int32)\n    info = memory.get_tensor_memory_info(tensor)\n    \n    assert info[\"shape\"] == (32, 32, 32)\n    assert info[\"dtype\"] == torch.int32\n    assert info[\"size_bytes\"] == 32**3 * 4  # int32 = 4 bytes\n    assert info[\"is_contiguous\"] == True"
}

{
  "file_path": "/Users/poldrack/Dropbox/code/agentic-coding/fastlabel/src/fastlabel/utils/memory.py",
  "content": "\"\"\"Memory management utilitie...

        
        

            
{
  "file_path": "/Users/poldrack/Dropbox/code/agentic-coding/fastlabel/src/fastlabel/utils/memory.py",
  "content": "\"\"\"Memory management utilities for GPU-accelerated labeling.\"\"\"\n\nfrom typing import Dict, List, Tuple, Any, Optional\nimport torch\nimport psutil\nfrom collections import defaultdict\n\n\ndef estimate_memory_usage(\n    shape: Tuple[int, ...], \n    input_dtype: torch.dtype, \n    output_dtype: torch.dtype\n) -> int:\n    \"\"\"\n    Estimate memory usage for labeling operation.\n    \n    Args:\n        shape: Tensor shape\n        input_dtype: Input tensor dtype\n        output_dtype: Output tensor dtype\n        \n    Returns:\n        Estimated memory usage in bytes\n    \"\"\"\n    num_elements = 1\n    for dim in shape:\n        num_elements *= dim\n    \n    # Calculate bytes per element\n    input_bytes = torch.zeros(1, dtype=input_dtype).element_size()\n    output_bytes = torch.zeros(1, dtype=output_dtype).element_size()\n    \n    # Estimate: input + output + 2x overhead for intermediate tensors\n    total_bytes = num_elements * (input_bytes + output_bytes) * 2\n    \n    return total_bytes\n\n\ndef get_available_memory(device: torch.device) -> int:\n    \"\"\"\n    Get available memory for device.\n    \n    Args:\n        device: Target device\n        \n    Returns:\n        Available memory in bytes\n    \"\"\"\n    if device.type == \"cuda\":\n        if not torch.cuda.is_available():\n            return 0\n        # Get GPU memory\n        total_mem = torch.cuda.get_device_properties(device).total_memory\n        allocated_mem = torch.cuda.memory_allocated(device)\n        return total_mem - allocated_mem\n        \n    elif device.type == \"mps\":\n        if not torch.backends.mps.is_available():\n            return 0\n        # MPS shares system memory - estimate conservatively\n        system_mem = psutil.virtual_memory()\n        return int(system_mem.available * 0.5)  # Use 50% of available system memory\n        \n    else:  # CPU\n        # System memory\n        system_mem = psutil.virtual_memory()\n        return system_mem.available\n\n\ndef check_memory_availability(\n    shape: Tuple[int, ...],\n    input_dtype: torch.dtype,\n    output_dtype: torch.dtype,\n    device: torch.device\n) -> bool:\n    \"\"\"\n    Check if tensor fits in available memory.\n    \n    Args:\n        shape: Tensor shape\n        input_dtype: Input tensor dtype\n        output_dtype: Output tensor dtype\n        device: Target device\n        \n    Returns:\n        True if tensor fits in memory\n    \"\"\"\n    required_memory = estimate_memory_usage(shape, input_dtype, output_dtype)\n    available_memory = get_available_memory(device)\n    \n    # Use 80% of available memory as safety margin\n    return required_memory < (available_memory * 0.8)\n\n\nclass MemoryPool:\n    \"\"\"Memory pool for tensor reuse to reduce allocations.\"\"\"\n    \n    def __init__(self, device: torch.device):\n        \"\"\"\n        Initialize memory pool.\n        \n        Args:\n            device: Device for tensor allocations\n        \"\"\"\n        self.device = device\n        self._tensors: Dict[Tuple[torch.dtype, Tuple[int, ...]], List[torch.Tensor]] = defaultdict(list)\n    \n    def allocate(self, dtype: torch.dtype, shape: Tuple[int, ...]) -> torch.Tensor:\n        \"\"\"\n        Allocate tensor from pool or create new one.\n        \n        Args:\n            dtype: Tensor dtype\n            shape: Tensor shape\n            \n        Returns:\n            Allocated tensor (zeroed)\n        \"\"\"\n        key = (dtype, shape)\n        \n        # Try to reuse existing tensor\n        if key in self._tensors and len(self._tensors[key]) > 0:\n            tensor = self._tensors[key].pop()\n            tensor.zero_()  # Clear contents\n            return tensor\n        \n        # Create new tensor\n        return torch.zeros(shape, dtype=dtype, device=self.device)\n    \n    def deallocate(self, tensor: torch.Tensor) -> None:\n        \"\"\"\n        Return tensor to pool for reuse.\n        \n        Args:\n            tensor: Tensor to return to pool\n        \"\"\"\n        key = (tensor.dtype, tuple(tensor.shape))\n        self._tensors[key].append(tensor)\n    \n    def clear(self) -> None:\n        \"\"\"Clear all tensors from pool.\"\"\"\n        self._tensors.clear()\n    \n    def get_stats(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n        \"\"\"\n        Get pool statistics.\n        \n        Returns:\n            Dictionary with pool statistics\n        \"\"\"\n        total_tensors = sum(len(tensor_list) for tensor_list in self._tensors.values())\n        total_memory = 0\n        \n        for (dtype, shape), tensor_list in self._tensors.items():\n            if len(tensor_list) > 0:\n                element_size = torch.zeros(1, dtype=dtype).element_size()\n                tensor_size = element_size\n                for dim in shape:\n                    tensor_size *= dim\n                total_memory += tensor_size * len(tensor_list)\n        \n        return {\n            \"total_tensors\": total_tensors,\n            \"total_memory_bytes\": total_memory,\n            \"tensor_types\": len(self._tensors)\n        }\n\n\nclass MemoryContext:\n    \"\"\"Context manager for automatic memory management.\"\"\"\n    \n    def __init__(self, device: torch.device):\n        \"\"\"\n        Initialize memory context.\n        \n        Args:\n            device: Device for memory management\n        \"\"\"\n        self.device = device\n        self.pool = MemoryPool(device)\n        self._allocated_tensors: List[torch.Tensor] = []\n    \n    def __enter__(self) -> 'MemoryContext':\n        \"\"\"Enter context.\"\"\"\n        return self\n    \n    def __exit__(self, exc_type, exc_val, exc_tb):\n        \"\"\"Exit context and cleanup memory.\"\"\"\n        # Return all allocated tensors to pool\n        for tensor in self._allocated_tensors:\n            self.pool.deallocate(tensor)\n        \n        # Clear pool\n        self.pool.clear()\n    \n    def allocate_tensor(self, dtype: torch.dtype, shape: Tuple[int, ...]) -> torch.Tensor:\n        \"\"\"\n        Allocate tensor within context.\n        \n        Args:\n            dtype: Tensor dtype\n            shape: Tensor shape\n            \n        Returns:\n            Allocated tensor\n        \"\"\"\n        tensor = self.pool.allocate(dtype, shape)\n        self._allocated_tensors.append(tensor)\n        return tensor\n\n\ndef optimize_memory_layout(tensor: torch.Tensor) -> torch.Tensor:\n    \"\"\"\n    Optimize tensor memory layout for better performance.\n    \n    Args:\n        tensor: Input tensor\n        \n    Returns:\n        Tensor with optimized memory layout\n    \"\"\"\n    if not tensor.is_contiguous():\n        return tensor.contiguous()\n    return tensor\n\n\ndef get_tensor_memory_info(tensor: torch.Tensor) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n    \"\"\"\n    Get detailed memory information for tensor.\n    \n    Args:\n        tensor: Tensor to analyze\n        \n    Returns:\n        Dictionary with memory information\n    \"\"\"\n    element_size = tensor.element_size()\n    total_elements = tensor.numel()\n    total_bytes = element_size * total_elements\n    \n    return {\n        \"shape\": tuple(tensor.shape),\n        \"dtype\": tensor.dtype,\n        \"device\": tensor.device,\n        \"element_size_bytes\": element_size,\n        \"total_elements\": total_elements,\n        \"size_bytes\": total_bytes,\n        \"is_contiguous\": tensor.is_contiguous(),\n        \"storage_size\": tensor.storage().size() if tensor.storage() else 0\n    }"
}

  "content": "\"\"\"Tests for block processing utilitie...

        
        

            
{
  "file_path": "/Users/poldrack/Dropbox/code/agentic-coding/fastlabel/tests/test_blocks.py",
  "content": "\"\"\"Tests for block processing utilities.\"\"\"\n\nimport pytest\nimport torch\nfrom fastlabel.core import blocks\n\n\nclass TestBlockDivision:\n    \"\"\"Test 3D volume block division.\"\"\"\n    \n    def test_divide_volume_into_blocks_simple(self):\n        \"\"\"Test simple volume division into 2x2x2 blocks.\"\"\"\n        # 8x8x8 volume should divide evenly into 4x4x4 = 64 blocks\n        volume_shape = (8, 8, 8)\n        block_size = (2, 2, 2)\n        \n        result = blocks.divide_volume_into_blocks(volume_shape, block_size)\n        \n        assert result.num_blocks == (4, 4, 4)\n        assert result.total_blocks == 64\n        assert result.block_size == block_size\n        assert result.volume_shape == volume_shape\n    \n    def test_divide_volume_with_padding(self):\n        \"\"\"Test volume division with padding for non-divisible sizes.\"\"\"\n        # 9x9x9 volume with 2x2x2 blocks needs padding\n        volume_shape = (9, 9, 9)\n        block_size = (2, 2, 2)\n        \n        result = blocks.divide_volume_into_blocks(volume_shape, block_size)\n        \n        # Should pad to 10x10x10 and create 5x5x5 = 125 blocks\n        assert result.num_blocks == (5, 5, 5)\n        assert result.total_blocks == 125\n        assert result.padded_shape == (10, 10, 10)\n    \n    def test_get_block_coordinates(self):\n        \"\"\"Test getting coordinates for specific block.\"\"\"\n        volume_shape = (8, 8, 8)\n        block_size = (2, 2, 2)\n        \n        block_info = blocks.divide_volume_into_blocks(volume_shape, block_size)\n        \n        # Test corner block (0, 0, 0)\n        coords = blocks.get_block_coordinates(block_info, (0, 0, 0))\n        expected = {\n            \"start\": (0, 0, 0),\n            \"end\": (2, 2, 2),\n            \"center\": (1, 1, 1)\n        }\n        assert coords == expected\n        \n        # Test block (1, 1, 1)\n        coords = blocks.get_block_coordinates(block_info, (1, 1, 1))\n        expected = {\n            \"start\": (2, 2, 2),\n            \"end\": (4, 4, 4),\n            \"center\": (3, 3, 3)\n        }\n        assert coords == expected\n    \n    def test_get_block_neighbors_6_connectivity(self):\n        \"\"\"Test finding neighbors with 6-connectivity.\"\"\"\n        volume_shape = (8, 8, 8)\n        block_info = blocks.divide_volume_into_blocks(volume_shape, (2, 2, 2))\n        \n        # Block (1, 1, 1) should have 6 neighbors\n        neighbors = blocks.get_block_neighbors(block_info, (1, 1, 1), connectivity=6)\n        \n        expected_neighbors = [\n            (0, 1, 1),  # -z\n            (2, 1, 1),  # +z\n            (1, 0, 1),  # -y\n            (1, 2, 1),  # +y\n            (1, 1, 0),  # -x\n            (1, 1, 2),  # +x\n        ]\n        \n        assert len(neighbors) == 6\n        assert set(neighbors) == set(expected_neighbors)\n    \n    def test_get_block_neighbors_26_connectivity(self):\n        \"\"\"Test finding neighbors with 26-connectivity.\"\"\"\n        volume_shape = (8, 8, 8)\n        block_info = blocks.divide_volume_into_blocks(volume_shape, (2, 2, 2))\n        \n        # Block (1, 1, 1) should have 26 neighbors\n        neighbors = blocks.get_block_neighbors(block_info, (1, 1, 1), connectivity=26)\n        \n        # Should include all blocks in 3x3x3 neighborhood except center\n        assert len(neighbors) == 26\n        \n        # Verify a few specific neighbors\n        assert (0, 0, 0) in neighbors  # corner\n        assert (2, 2, 2) in neighbors  # opposite corner\n        assert (0, 1, 1) in neighbors  # face neighbor\n    \n    def test_get_block_neighbors_boundary(self):\n        \"\"\"Test neighbors for blocks at volume boundaries.\"\"\"\n        volume_shape = (4, 4, 4)\n        block_info = blocks.divide_volume_into_blocks(volume_shape, (2, 2, 2))\n        \n        # Corner block (0, 0, 0) should have fewer neighbors\n        neighbors = blocks.get_block_neighbors(block_info, (0, 0, 0), connectivity=6)\n        \n        expected_neighbors = [\n            (1, 0, 0),  # +z\n            (0, 1, 0),  # +y\n            (0, 0, 1),  # +x\n        ]\n        \n        assert len(neighbors) == 3\n        assert set(neighbors) == set(expected_neighbors)\n\n\nclass TestBlockMapping:\n    \"\"\"Test mapping between blocks and voxels.\"\"\"\n    \n    def test_voxel_to_block_mapping(self):\n        \"\"\"Test mapping voxel coordinates to block index.\"\"\"\n        volume_shape = (8, 8, 8)\n        block_info = blocks.divide_volume_into_blocks(volume_shape, (2, 2, 2))\n        \n        # Voxel (0, 0, 0) should map to block (0, 0, 0)\n        block_idx = blocks.voxel_to_block(block_info, (0, 0, 0))\n        assert block_idx == (0, 0, 0)\n        \n        # Voxel (3, 3, 3) should map to block (1, 1, 1)\n        block_idx = blocks.voxel_to_block(block_info, (3, 3, 3))\n        assert block_idx == (1, 1, 1)\n        \n        # Voxel (7, 7, 7) should map to block (3, 3, 3)\n        block_idx = blocks.voxel_to_block(block_info, (7, 7, 7))\n        assert block_idx == (3, 3, 3)\n    \n    def test_block_to_voxel_mapping(self):\n        \"\"\"Test mapping block index to voxel range.\"\"\"\n        volume_shape = (8, 8, 8)\n        block_info = blocks.divide_volume_into_blocks(volume_shape, (2, 2, 2))\n        \n        # Block (0, 0, 0) should contain voxels (0,0,0) to (1,1,1)\n        voxel_range = blocks.block_to_voxel_range(block_info, (0, 0, 0))\n        expected = {\n            \"z_start\": 0, \"z_end\": 2,\n            \"y_start\": 0, \"y_end\": 2,\n            \"x_start\": 0, \"x_end\": 2\n        }\n        assert voxel_range == expected\n        \n        # Block (1, 1, 1) should contain voxels (2,2,2) to (3,3,3)\n        voxel_range = blocks.block_to_voxel_range(block_info, (1, 1, 1))\n        expected = {\n            \"z_start\": 2, \"z_end\": 4,\n            \"y_start\": 2, \"y_end\": 4,\n            \"x_start\": 2, \"x_end\": 4\n        }\n        assert voxel_range == expected\n\n\nclass TestBlockTensorOperations:\n    \"\"\"Test operations on block tensors.\"\"\"\n    \n    def test_create_block_labels_tensor(self, device):\n        \"\"\"Test creating block labels tensor.\"\"\"\n        volume_shape = (8, 8, 8)\n        block_info = blocks.divide_volume_into_blocks(volume_shape, (2, 2, 2))\n        \n        labels_tensor = blocks.create_block_labels_tensor(block_info, device)\n        \n        assert labels_tensor.shape == (4, 4, 4)  # num_blocks\n        assert labels_tensor.dtype == torch.int32\n        assert labels_tensor.device.type == device.type\n        \n        # Should be initialized with sequential block IDs\n        expected_values = torch.arange(64, device=device).reshape(4, 4, 4)\n        torch.testing.assert_close(labels_tensor, expected_values)\n    \n    def test_extract_block_from_volume(self, device):\n        \"\"\"Test extracting a 2x2x2 block from volume.\"\"\"\n        # Create test volume\n        volume = torch.arange(64, device=device).reshape(4, 4, 4).float()\n        \n        block_info = blocks.divide_volume_into_blocks((4, 4, 4), (2, 2, 2))\n        \n        # Extract block (0, 0, 0)\n        block_data = blocks.extract_block_from_volume(volume, block_info, (0, 0, 0))\n        \n        assert block_data.shape == (2, 2, 2)\n        \n        # Check values - should be volume[0:2, 0:2, 0:2]\n        expected = volume[0:2, 0:2, 0:2]\n        torch.testing.assert_close(block_data, expected)\n    \n    def test_insert_block_into_volume(self, device):\n        \"\"\"Test inserting block data back into volume.\"\"\"\n        # Create test volume and block\n        volume = torch.zeros(4, 4, 4, device=device, dtype=torch.int32)\n        block_data = torch.ones(2, 2, 2, device=device, dtype=torch.int32) * 42\n        \n        block_info = blocks.divide_volume_into_blocks((4, 4, 4), (2, 2, 2))\n        \n        # Insert block at (1, 1, 1)\n        blocks.insert_block_into_volume(volume, block_data, block_info, (1, 1, 1))\n        \n        # Check that the correct region is filled\n        assert volume[2:4, 2:4, 2:4].unique().item() == 42\n        assert volume[0:2, 0:2, 0:2].unique().item() == 0  # Other regions unchanged\n\n\nclass TestBlockProcessingPipeline:\n    \"\"\"Test complete block processing pipeline.\"\"\"\n    \n    def test_process_volume_by_blocks(self, device):\n        \"\"\"Test processing entire volume block by block.\"\"\"\n        # Create binary volume\n        volume = torch.zeros(6, 6, 6, dtype=torch.bool, device=device)\n        volume[1:3, 1:3, 1:3] = True  # Single component\n        volume[4:6, 4:6, 4:6] = True  # Another component\n        \n        block_info = blocks.divide_volume_into_blocks((6, 6, 6), (2, 2, 2))\n        \n        # Get blocks with foreground voxels\n        foreground_blocks = blocks.get_foreground_blocks(volume, block_info)\n        \n        # Should find blocks that contain True voxels\n        assert len(foreground_blocks) > 0\n        \n        # Verify each foreground block actually contains foreground voxels\n        for block_idx in foreground_blocks:\n            block_data = blocks.extract_block_from_volume(volume, block_info, block_idx)\n            assert block_data.any().item() == True\n    \n    def test_block_connectivity_analysis(self, device):\n        \"\"\"Test analyzing connectivity between blocks.\"\"\"\n        volume_shape = (4, 4, 4)\n        block_info = blocks.divide_volume_into_blocks(volume_shape, (2, 2, 2))\n        \n        # Create simple connectivity pattern\n        block_connections = blocks.analyze_block_connectivity(\n            block_info, \n            foreground_blocks=[(0, 0, 0), (0, 0, 1), (1, 1, 1)],\n            connectivity=6\n        )\n        \n        assert isinstance(block_connections, dict)\n        \n        # Should have connections between adjacent blocks\n        assert (0, 0, 0) in block_connections\n        assert (0, 0, 1) in block_connections[(0, 0, 0)]"
}
